Label: 16-msec total ion densities - Rod Heelis (University of Texas, Dallas)

VariableDescription.Name: ionDensity
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     TITLE                           DE-2 RPA 1/64-sec Total Ion Density
#     PROJECT                         DE>Dynamics Explorer
#     SOURCE_NAME                     DE>Dynamics Explorer
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric  Ionospheric Interactions
#     DESCRIPTOR                      duct16ms> Duct 16ms
#     DATA_TYPE                       rpa>Retarding PotentialAnalyzer
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TEXT                            The Retarding Potential Analyzer (RPA) measured the bulk ion velocity in the                           
#     TEXT                             direction of the spacecraft motion, the constituent ion concentrations, and                           
#     TEXT                             the ion temperature along the satellite path. These parameters were derived                           
#     TEXT                             from a least squares fit to the ion number flux vs energy curve obtained by                           
#     TEXT                             sweeping or stepping the voltage applied to the internal retarding grids of                           
#     TEXT                             the RPA. In addition, a separate wide aperture sensor, a duct sensor, was flown                       
#     TEXT                             to measure the spectral characteristics of iregularities in the total ion concentration.              
#     TEXT                             The measured parameters obtained from this investigation were important to                            
#     TEXT                             the understanding of mechanisms that influence the plasma; i.e., to understand                        
#     TEXT                             the coupling between the solar wind and the earth's atmosphere. The measurements                      
#     TEXT                             were made with a multigridded planar retarding potential analyzer very similar                        
#     TEXT                             in concept and geometry to the instruments carried on the AE satellites. The                          
#     TEXT                             retarding potential was variable in the range from approximately +32 to 0 volts.                      
#     TEXT                             The details of this voltage trace, and whether it was continuous or stepped,                          
#     TEXT                             depended on the operating mode of the instrument. Specific parameters deduced                         
#     TEXT                             from these measurements were ion temperature; vehicle potential; ram component                        
#     TEXT                             of the ion drift velocity; the ion and electron concentration irregularity                            
#     TEXT                             spectrum; and the concentration of H+, He+, O+, and Fe+, and of molecular ions                        
#     TEXT                             near perigee. Additional details are in W. B. Hanson et al., Space Sci. Instrum.,                     
#                                      v. 5, n. 4, p. 503, 1981.                                                                             
#                                     It includes the DUCT portion of the high resolutiondata from the Dynamics Explorer                     
#                                      2 (DE-2) Retarding Potential Analyzer (RPA) for the whole DE-2 mission time                           
#                                      period in ASCII format. This version was generated at NSSDC from the PI-provided                      
#                                      binary data (SPIO-00232). The DUCT files include RPA measurements of the total                        
#                                      ion concentration every 64 times per second. Due to a failure in the instrument                       
#                                      memory system RPA data are not available from 81317 06:26:40 UT to 82057 13:16:00                     
#                                      UT. This data set is based on the revised version of the RPA files that was                           
#                                      submitted by the PI team in June of 1995. The revised RPA data include a correction                   
#                                      to the spacecraft potential.                                                                          
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0241
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  de2_duct16ms_rpa
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 de2_duct16ms_rpa_00000000_v01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      16-msec total ion densities
#     PI_NAME                         Rod Heelis
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  University of Texas, Dallas
#     NSSDC_ID                        SPIO-00120
#     MISSION_GROUP                   DE
#                                     !___Magnetospheric Data
#                                     !___ITM Data including Earth Imaging and Ground-Based
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Particles (space)
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. NSSDC standard-reference time value (ion density).
#  2. Total ion (number) density in cm-3
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 19:11:11 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. Total ion (number) density in cm-3
#
TIME_SINCE_0_A.D._DEN   TOTAL_ION_DENSITY
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms               cm-3
03-08-1981 10:49:21.431          -3.10000

VariableDescription.Name: wb1
VariableDescription.LongDescription: Spectral power in wide band filter 1 (630 - 1700 Hz)
VariableDescription.Header:

#     TEXT                             from a least squares fit to the ion number flux vs energy curve obtained by

#     TEXT                             the RPA. In addition, a separate wide aperture sensor, a duct sensor, was flown

#     TEXT                             The measured parameters obtained from this investigation were important to                            
#     TEXT                             the understanding of mechanisms that influence the plasma; i.e., to understand

#     TEXT                             were made with a multigridded planar retarding potential analyzer very similar                        
#     TEXT                             in concept and geometry to the instruments carried on the AE satellites. The

#     PI_AFFILIATION                  University of Texas, Dallas
#     NSSDC_ID                        SPIO-00120
#     MISSION_GROUP                   DE
#                                     !___Magnetospheric Data
#                                     !___ITM Data including Earth Imaging and Ground-Based
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Particles (space)
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. NSSDC standard-reference time value (wide-band 1).
#  2. Spectral power in wide band filter 1 (630 - 1700 Hz)
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 19:11:12 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. Spectral power in wide band filter 1 (630 - 1700 Hz)
#
TIME_SINCE_0_A.D._WIDE-BAND_1      SP_WBF_1
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms                 1/Hz
      03-08-1981 10:49:21.463       0.00000

VariableDescription.Name: wb6

#     TEXT                             near perigee. Additional details are in W. B. Hanson et al., Space Sci. Instrum.,                     
#                                      v. 5, n. 4, p. 503, 1981.                                                                             
#                                     It includes the DUCT portion of the high resolutiondata from the Dynamics Explorer                     
#                                      2 (DE-2) Retarding Potential Analyzer (RPA) for the whole DE-2 mission time                           
#                                      period in ASCII format. This version was generated at NSSDC from the PI-provided                      
#                                      binary data (SPIO-00232). The DUCT files include RPA measurements of the total                        
#                                      ion concentration every 64 times per second. Due to a failure in the instrument                       
#                                      memory system RPA data are not available from 81317 06:26:40 UT to 82057 13:16:00                     
#                                      UT. This data set is based on the revised version of the RPA files that was                           
#                                      submitted by the PI team in June of 1995. The revised RPA data include a correction                   
#                                      to the spacecraft potential.

VariableDescription.Name: glat
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     TITLE                           DE-2 RPA 1/64-sec Total Ion Density
#     PROJECT                         DE>Dynamics Explorer
#     SOURCE_NAME                     DE>Dynamics Explorer
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric  Ionospheric Interactions
#     DESCRIPTOR                      duct16ms> Duct 16ms
#     DATA_TYPE                       rpa>Retarding PotentialAnalyzer
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TEXT                            The Retarding Potential Analyzer (RPA) measured the bulk ion velocity in the                           
#     TEXT                             direction of the spacecraft motion, the constituent ion concentrations, and                           
#     TEXT                             the ion temperature along the satellite path. These parameters were derived                           
#     TEXT                             from a least squares fit to the ion number flux vs energy curve obtained by                           
#     TEXT                             sweeping or stepping the voltage applied to the internal retarding grids of                           
#     TEXT                             the RPA. In addition, a separate wide aperture sensor, a duct sensor, was flown                       
#     TEXT                             to measure the spectral characteristics of iregularities in the total ion concentration.              
#     TEXT                             The measured parameters obtained from this investigation were important to                            
#     TEXT                             the understanding of mechanisms that influence the plasma; i.e., to understand                        
#     TEXT                             the coupling between the solar wind and the earth's atmosphere. The measurements                      
#     TEXT                             were made with a multigridded planar retarding potential analyzer very similar                        
#     TEXT                             in concept and geometry to the instruments carried on the AE satellites. The                          
#     TEXT                             retarding potential was variable in the range from approximately +32 to 0 volts.                      
#     TEXT                             The details of this voltage trace, and whether it was continuous or stepped,                          
#     TEXT                             depended on the operating mode of the instrument. Specific parameters deduced                         
#     TEXT                             from these measurements were ion temperature; vehicle potential; ram component                        
#     TEXT                             of the ion drift velocity; the ion and electron concentration irregularity                            
#     TEXT                             spectrum; and the concentration of H+, He+, O+, and Fe+, and of molecular ions                        
#     TEXT                             near perigee. Additional details are in W. B. Hanson et al., Space Sci. Instrum.,                     
#                                      v. 5, n. 4, p. 503, 1981.                                                                             
#                                     It includes the DUCT portion of the high resolutiondata from the Dynamics Explorer                     
#                                      2 (DE-2) Retarding Potential Analyzer (RPA) for the whole DE-2 mission time                           
#                                      period in ASCII format. This version was generated at NSSDC from the PI-provided                      
#                                      binary data (SPIO-00232). The DUCT files include RPA measurements of the total                        
#                                      ion concentration every 64 times per second. Due to a failure in the instrument                       
#                                      memory system RPA data are not available from 81317 06:26:40 UT to 82057 13:16:00                     
#                                      UT. This data set is based on the revised version of the RPA files that was                           
#                                      submitted by the PI team in June of 1995. The revised RPA data include a correction                   
#                                      to the spacecraft potential.                                                                          
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0241
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  de2_duct16ms_rpa
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 de2_duct16ms_rpa_00000000_v01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      16-msec total ion densities
#     PI_NAME                         Rod Heelis
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  University of Texas, Dallas
#     NSSDC_ID                        SPIO-00120
#     MISSION_GROUP                   DE
#                                     !___Magnetospheric Data
#                                     !___ITM Data including Earth Imaging and Ground-Based
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Particles (space)
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. NSSDC standard-reference time value.
#  2. Geographic Latitude in degrees
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 19:11:14 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. Geographic Latitude in degrees
#
TIME_SINCE_0_A.D.       GEOG_LATITUDE
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms            deg
03-08-1981 10:49:21.431      -23.9300
